name: Energy Efficiency Champs
title: Top GDP per Energy Use
description: In 2023, Ireland achieved a GDP of $50.79 per kg of oil equivalent, showcasing its top-tier energy efficiency globally.

name: Minimal Transport Imports
title: Lowest Transport Service Imports
description: Ireland's transport services accounted for only 1.47% of its service imports in 2023, highlighting its minimal reliance on foreign transport services.

name: Tech Import Titans
title: High Tech Service Imports
description: In 2023, 86.45% of Ireland's commercial service imports were in computer, communications, and other tech services, indicating a strong focus on technology.

name: Manufacturing Decline
title: Negative Manufacturing Growth
description: Ireland's manufacturing sector saw a significant decline with a -23.93% growth rate in 2023, indicating challenges in the industry.

name: Reading Proficiency Leaders
title: Low Learning Poverty
description: In 2021, only 2.33% of children in Ireland were below minimum reading proficiency, showcasing the country's strong primary education system.

name: Maternal Health Excellence
title: Lowest Maternal Mortality
description: Ireland reported a maternal mortality ratio of just 1 per 100,000 live births in 2015, reflecting its exceptional maternal healthcare services.

name: Capital Consumption Concerns
title: High Fixed Capital Consumption
description: In 2021, Ireland's consumption of fixed capital was 34.64% of its GNI, indicating a high rate of capital depreciation.

name: Income Outflow Woes
title: Net Income Deficit
description: In 2022, Ireland experienced a net primary income deficit of $150.27 billion, highlighting significant income outflows.
